com.atakmap.android.maps.hittest

Interface DeepHitTestControlQuery

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DeepHitTestQuery
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FeatureDataStoreDeepMapItemQuery, GRGDeepMapItemQuery

    public interface DeepHitTestControlQuery
extends DeepHitTestQuery
    An extension of DeepHitTestQuery that may utilize a list of HitTestControl objects which were retrieved earlier in the stack

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.util.SortedSet<MapItem> deepHitTest(MapView mapView, HitTestQueryParameters params)
      Perform a hit-test given a set of query parameters NOTE: This is called on the GL thread
      java.util.SortedSet<MapItem> deepHitTest(MapView mapView, HitTestQueryParameters params, java.util.Map<Layer2,java.util.Collection<HitTestControl>> controls)
      Perform a hit test with access to hit test controls NOTE: This is called on the GL thread with a lock on the map controls Do NOT call MapRenderer3#visitControl(Layer2, Visitor, Class) or any related method here or else the app will deadlock.

    • Method Detail

      • deepHitTest

        default java.util.SortedSet<MapItem> deepHitTest(MapView mapView,
                                                 HitTestQueryParameters params)
        Description copied from interface: DeepHitTestQuery
        Perform a hit-test given a set of query parameters NOTE: This is called on the GL thread
        Specified by:
        deepHitTest in interface DeepHitTestQuery
        Parameters:
        mapView - Map view instance
        params - Hit-test query parameters (location of hit, bounds, etc.)
        Returns:
        Hit map items or null if none hit

      • deepHitTest

        java.util.SortedSet<MapItem> deepHitTest(MapView mapView,
                                         HitTestQueryParameters params,
                                         java.util.Map<Layer2,java.util.Collection<HitTestControl>> controls)
        Perform a hit test with access to hit test controls NOTE: This is called on the GL thread with a lock on the map controls Do NOT call MapRenderer3#visitControl(Layer2, Visitor, Class) or any related method here or else the app will deadlock. This is why the controls are provided upfront.
        Parameters:
        mapView - Map view
        params - Hit test parameters
        controls - Hit test controls mapped by layer
        Returns:
        Set of map items that were hit
